node.title: Four people accused of murdering Ballarat woman to stand trial in Supreme Court
node.description: Ballarat woman Kobie Parfitt's remains were found in a mine shaft in December 2020. A year later, four people have been ordered to stand trial over her murder.
node.content:
["Four people accused of\u00a0murdering Ballarat woman Kobie Parfitt have been ordered to stand trial in the Victorian Supreme Court.", "Shannon Jeffrey, Renee Reynolds, Brendan Prestage and Jacob Ford have pleaded not guilty to charges relating to the murder of the 43-year-old, who went missing in April 2020.", "Her remains were found in a mine shaft at Snake Valley, near Ballarat, in December 2020.", "Magistrate Ron Saines said there was enough evidence for a jury to conclude Ms Parfitt feared she was in \"the gravest of danger\" from the quartet.", "\"The evidence also shows that all four accused were with\u00a0her at times on the day and prior to her death\u00a0in circumstances which demonstrate some level of control, if not intimidation,\" he said.\u00a0", "\"The Crown case includes evidence which demonstrates that Kobie Parfitt met with great violence on April 28, 2020, as a result of which she\u2019s died and was dumped into a mineshaft in Snake Valley.\"", "The four people all pleaded not guilty, and no bail application was made.\u00a0", "They will face a directions hearing in the Victorian Supreme Court later this month.\u00a0", "
Sufficient evidence for a guilty verdict
", "Magistrate Saines said the evidence put forward by the Crown was sufficient, in his opinion, that a jury would find the four accused as guilty.\u00a0", "He told the court there was sufficient evidence that Mr Jeffrey held a serious grievance with Ms Parfitt, which was expressed and acted upon.\u00a0", "\"Telecommunication evidence is capable of confirming involvement in the death by two of the accused, and of implicating the other two,\" Magistrate Saines said.", "The\u00a0committal hearing last week heard Ms Parfitt's cause of death could not be determined.", "Detective Senior Constable Jason Stewart from the Missing Persons Squad told the court he believed Ms Parfitt was strangled during an altercation in her Ballarat backyard on April 28, 2020, when all four accused were present.", "He conceded under cross examination that there were no witnesses to this alleged incident, beyond the four accused.", "A neighbour told the committal hearing she saw Ms Parfitt on April 28, 2020 and that she seemed afraid.", "Ms Parfitt told the witness she feared the accused were going to put her in the boot of a car, and asked the witness to call the police but later changed her mind.", "", "
Police believe mother of four Kobie Parfitt has been murdered.(Supplied: Victoria Police)
", "The witness said Ms Parfitt got back into a car with two of the accused and was then driven across the street and\u00a0into the backyard of Ms Parfitt's home.", "The court heard a large gate was closed, obscuring the view of the backyard, and Ms Parfitt was never seen again.", "Detective Senior Constable Stewart said tracking Mr Prestage's mobile phone shows he visited the Snake Valley area later that night.", "The court also heard Mr Ford told\u00a0police he barely knew Ms Parfitt and had never been to her house, but this was contradicted by a witness who saw\u00a0Mr Ford at Ms Parfitt's house on the day police believe she was murdered.", "During the committal hearing, defence lawyers argued that there was no direct evidence the four accused were involved in Ms Parfitt's death, and that the prosecution case relied on \"inferences\".", "The defence also argued the prosecution case failed to show evidence any of their clients were present when Ms Parfitt's body was dumped in the Snake Valley mine shaft.", "The lawyer representing Mr Ford painted Ms Parfitt as someone who \"was not a saint by any stretch\", noting she had a history of drugs and suggested there were \"people who had it in for her\"."]
